Articles.Content: Are there any planet packs out there that have realistically-scaled planets? I want to do an RSS game with multiple solar systems, but all the packs I've seen are scaled for stock KSP (i.e., a tenth the size of real planets).

what do you mean? the Real Solar System mod re-scales all the planets to match their real-life counterparts' dimensions & attributes (atmospheres, orbital tilts, etc. etc.)

there is also Real Solar System Expansion which adds several missing moons & asteroids.

I play with these 2 and the Realism Overhaul suite and it's the most fun I have had with a game in years! Endless possibilities and very challenging, crucial fact that keeps you going and engaged with the game!

EDIT: ah - I re-red your post and think I get what you are asking now: you are already playing with RSS and you want to add a new Solar System with new (fictional?) planets with similar-to-real-life attributes? If so, I don't know any other planet packs

Edited January 29, 2016 by pvnkb1tch

EDIT:

now that I think about it, RSS deletes every body before generating its planets. so chances are most of the planet packs won't even load.

you'll need to write a patch to "save" those planets from being deleted by RSS before doing anything else

Edited March 23, 2016 by Sigma88
there is something called RSS Extrasolar, that might be what you are looking for
